page.title: 13CONSERVATION IN PADBURY
page.content: Most of Padbury is a conservation area so extra care is taken when anyone seeks planning permission to build or alter a house. The Parish Council's views are always sought on planning matters, although the "powers that be" in Aylesbury do sometimes go against the advice of the Parish councillors. Generally speaking planning permission is granted for houses to be built on derelict sites or waste ground. A good example of this is the building of 17 houses on the site of the former railway station and yard. The end result satisfies most people but there was considerable local opposition in the beginning. However it has proved much more difficult to obtain planning permission for infilling on green field sites. The older villagers think each field lost is one too many.
